messages: 62ce8b9c19b6eed863b8e97d5f0bddc0 (17:20): Hey guys, is anyone here familiar with Tomkat, more specifically how I would create a secure certificate to insert into tomkat?
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (17:20): openssl is a set of cryptographic libraries. mod_ssl uses those libraries to implement https handling in apache

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (17:20): mod_ssl is http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/ssl/ or http://www.modssl.org/ (for 1.3) or http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_ssl.html or http://cvs.apache.org/~mads/ac2004/MO18mod_ssl.pdf or see mod_gnutls for an alternative
62ce8b9c19b6eed863b8e97d5f0bddc0 (17:21): so I just need to create a self signed certificate then find out how to insert it into tomkat
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (17:21): i'm looking for a how-to, cause i thought we had one, but the one tiptap gave should work, too :)
62ce8b9c19b6eed863b8e97d5f0bddc0 (17:28): its a really odd setup here
62ce8b9c19b6eed863b8e97d5f0bddc0 (17:28): its not done with apache its done with IIS much to my frustration
62ce8b9c19b6eed863b8e97d5f0bddc0 (17:28): but i figure you guys would know baout tomkat
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (17:30): iis is Internet Information Services. a microsoft product or not supported in this channel or aka Internet Interruption Service
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (17:35): erm Apache is set to bind to 2 different IP's and tux uses a different one...

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (17:58): mod_unique_id is http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_unique_id.html or unnecessary to most users, and should be disabled (removed from httpd.conf) if it causes problems or see http://bugs.gentoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=60515
4e146f288acade673107ec4c247f2dbb (17:59): let me try and comment out that line
4e146f288acade673107ec4c247f2dbb (17:59): and yet it fails to start
